column3: ACK, with one nit: please a debug message when an exception happens. I think completely ignoring it is not a good idea for troubleshooting and such.\n
I was trying to avoid introducing any risk of causing another exception while writing a debug log message.\n
Moved the catch inside the if (fDebug), and made it print a debug message.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4903_efad808aaece74a0308a77e35ad35e845edb97f8/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te
I can test, have a reproduction already.\n
Tests out fine, I see it log the unparsable reject message. ACK.\n
Message needs a `\n` at the end \n
